tit.cmt: 新風館のウェブサイトの表記に合わせました。http://www.shin-puh-kan.com/index.html

sen.j: 新風館（しんぷうかん）は京都市中京区烏丸通姉小路通下ル場之町586-2にある複合商業施設。
sen.e: Shin-Puh-Kan is a complex commercial facility located at Bano Cho 586-2, Karasuma-dori Aneyakoji-dori Sagaru, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shin-Puh-Kan is a complex commercial facility located at Bano Cho 586-2, Karasuma-dori Aneyakoji-dori Sagaru, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Shin-Puh-Kan is a complex commercial facility located at 586-2, Bano-cho, Aneyakoji-dori Sagaru, Karasuma-dori, Nakagyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 地上3階建ての回廊式の建物に、ファッション・グルメ・インテリアなどを中心に、約30店舗が入っている。
sen.e: Its three story building of gallery-type structure houses about thirty shops, such as clothing stores, gourmet restaurants, and interior equipment stores.
Its three story building of gallery-type structure that houses about thirty shops, such as clothing stores, gourmet restaurants, and interior equipment stores.
Its three storey building of gallery-type structure that houses about thirty shops, such as clothing stores, gourmet restaurants, and interior equipment stores.

sen.j: 運営者はNTT都市開発と、新たに設立された株式会社新風社中。
sen.e: It is operated by NTT Urban Development Co. and newly established Shin-Puh-Syatyu Company.
It is operated by the NTT Urban Development Co. and the newly established Shin-Puh-Syatyu Company.
It is operated by the NTT Urban Development Co. and the newly established Shin-puh-syatyu Company.
sen.cmt: 新風社中（正しくは親風社中）のウェブサイトに合わせました。http://www.amane.co.jp/shinpuh/index.html

sen.j: 原形となる鉄筋コンクリート構造の洋館は、逓信省営繕課技師の吉田鉄郎による設計、清水組（現 清水建設）の施工で1926年竣工、1931年に増築された京都中央電話局。
sen.e: Its original Western-style ferroconcrete building used to be former Kyoto Central Telephone Office, which was designed by Tetsuro YOSHIDA, an architect of the Ministry of Communications Building and Repairs Section, constructed by Shimizu Gumi (now Shimizu Corporation), completed in 1926, and extended in 1931.

Its original Western-style ferroconcrete building used to be the former Kyoto Central Telephone Office, which was designed by Tetsuro YOSHIDA, an architect of the Ministry of Communications Building and Repairs Section, constructed by Shimizu Gumi (now Shimizu Corporation), completed in 1926, and extended in 1931.

Its original Western-style ferroconcrete building used to be the former Kyoto Central Telephone Office, which was designed by Tetsuro YOSHIDA, an architect of the Ministry of Communications Building and Repairs Section, constructed by Shimizu Gumi (now Shimizu Corporation), completed in 1926, and extended in 1931.

sen.j: 建設当初は電話交換オペレーションセンターとして使用され、のちに日本電信電話公社、日本電信電話、西日本電信電話の京都電電ビル西館となった。
sen.e: It was initially used as a telephone operation center, and later, turned to the west hall of Kyoto Telegraph and Telephone building of Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Public Corporation, Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corporation, and then Nippon Telegraph and Telephone West Corporation.

It was initially used as a telephone operation center, and later, was turned into the west hall of Kyoto Telegraph and Telephone building of Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Public Corporation, Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corporation, and then the Nippon Telegraph and Telephone West Corporation.

It was initially used as a telephone operation center, and later, was turned into the west hall of Kyoto Telegraph and Telephone building of Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Public Corporation, Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corporation, and then the Nippon Telegraph and Telephone West Corporation.

sen.j: 京都市登録有形文化財第1号（1983年6月1日登録）である。
sen.e: It was the first Registered Tangible Cultural Property registered by Kyoto City (registered June 1, 1983).
It was the first Registered as Tangible Cultural Property by Kyoto City (registered June 1, 1983).
It was the first Registered as Tangible Cultural Property by Kyoto City (registered June 1, 1983).

sen.j: 商業施設「新風館」への改装はNTT都市開発が事業主となり、NTTファシリティーズとリチャード ロジャース パートナーシップ ジャパンの設計、清水建設の施工で、2001年1月26日にオープンした。
sen.e: The renovation of it into a commercial facility 'Shin-Puh-Kan' was led by NTT Urban Development Co., the project owner, designed by NTT Facilities and Richard Rogers Partnership Japan, carried out by Shimizu Corporation, and completed to open on January 26, 2001.

It's renovation into a commercial facility 'Shin-Puh-Kan' was led by the NTT Urban Development Co., the project owner, designed by NTT Facilities and Richard Rogers Partnership Japan, carried out by Shimizu Corporation, and completed to open on January 26, 2001.

It's renovation into a commercial facility 'Shin-Puh-Kan' was led by the NTT Urban Development Co., the project owner, designed by NTT Facilities and Richard Rogers Partnership Japan, carried out by Shimizu Corporation, and completed to open on January 26, 2001.

sen.j: レンガ造り風の外観、ヨーロッパのパティオを思わせるレトロな雰囲気が特徴で、2004年度のグッドデザイン賞建築・環境デザイン部門、第12回BELCA賞ベストリフォーム部門を受賞した。
sen.e: It features its brick looking exterior and a retro-flavored structure with a European style patio, and won Good Design Award 2004 in the domain of Architecture and Environment Design, and the twelfth BELCA Award in 'Best Reform' domain (BELCA: Building and Equipment Life Cycle Association).

It features its brick looking exterior and a retro-flavored structure with a European style patio, and won the Good Design Award 2004 in the domain of Architecture and Environment Design, and the twelfth BELCA Award in 'Best Reform' domain (BELCA: Building and Equipment Life Cycle Association).

It features its brick looking exterior and a retro-flavored structure with a European style patio, and won the Good Design Award 2004 in the domain of Architecture and Environment Design, and the twelfth BELCA Award in Best Reform domain (BELCA: Building and Equipment Life Cycle Association).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションをのぞきました。

sen.j: 市内中心部でNPO法人が営業しているベロタクシーの拠点となっていたり、店舗を出したい起業希望者が京都市の助成を受けて屋台型店舗を出しているなど、流行の発信拠点にもなっている。
sen.e: It also plays a role of vogue initiator: it provides a base of Velotaxi operated by an NPO in the city center; it lets entrepreneurs set up stall-type shops supported by a grant from Kyoto City.
It also plays a role as a vogue initiator: it provides a base of Velotaxi operated by an NPO in the city center; it lets entrepreneurs set up stall-type shops supported by a grant from Kyoto City.
It also plays a role as a vogue initiator: It provides a base of Velotaxi operated by an NPO in the city center; it lets entrepreneurs set up stall-type shops supported by a grant from Kyoto City.

sen.j: 中庭のRe-Cueホール（リキュウホール）は、立ち見を含めると約1,500人が収容可能なオープンスペースホール。
sen.e: Its inner courtyard called 'Re-Cue Hall' is an open space hall with a capacity for about 1,500 people including standing audience.
Its inner courtyard called 'Re-Cue Hall' is an open space hall with a capacity for about 1,500 people including standing audience.
Its inner courtyard called 'Re-Cue Hall' is an open space hall with a capacity for about 1,500 people including standing audience.

sen.j: 円形のステージや250インチの大型スクリーン、音響設備、常設のカメラなどを備えており、コンサートやファッションショー、結婚式などに使われている。
sen.e: Equipped with a circular sage, a 250-inch large screen, audio equipment, and permanent cameras, it is used for concerts, fashion shows, and wedding receptions.
Equipped with a circular stage, a 250-inch large screen, audio equipment, and permanent cameras, it is used for concerts, fashion shows, and wedding receptions.
Equipped with a circular stage, a 250-inch large screen, audio equipment, and permanent cameras, it is used for concerts, fashion shows, and wedding receptions.

sen.j: 物販店舗1100 - 2000（金・土・祝前日は2100まで）
sen.e: Stores of goods: 11:00 to 20:00 (until 21:00 on Fridays, Saturdays, and the days before National Holidays)
Stores of goods: 11:00 to 20:00 (until 21:00 on Fridays, Saturdays, and the days before National Holidays)

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線・京都市営地下鉄東西線烏丸御池駅の5番出口から徒歩1分
sen.e: It is five minutes walk from No. 5 Exit of Karasumaoike Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line or Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line.
It is five minutes walk from No. 5 Exit of Karasumaoike Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line or Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line.
It is five minutes walk from Exit 5 of Karasuma Oike Station of Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line or Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line.
